intro: Parosela tuberculina, commonly known as the tubercled parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
